comment: This professor gives a huge amount of discussions and only grades a small portion of them. She also does not tell you which ones she is grading until the end of the semester. There was also no way for me to see my grades the entire semester, and I emailed her a few times. At the end of the semester, she said that I never asked.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Way too much reading and assignments every week. This course is honestly unreasonable. You can spend 12 hours over a few days just trying to get through the reading and not even get to the plethora of discussions. Not to mention, out of the 27 whopping discussions you do, she only grades 11 of them and doesn't tell you which ones she's grading.

I wanted to rate this class early in the semester to warn other students registering for future semesters. This class is not organized. The due dates are very random and often in the middle of the week. The links and discussions are always broken. The professor herself is nice and it may not be her fault. But I don't recommend this course.

Karen Pressley is a really interesting person. Her class has a lot of written assignments but the grading criteria are very clear.  She does have a book that she wrote that she uses for her class about her story and escaping Scientology. It can get tedious to read, but it is overall interesting. I recommend her class if you are at all interested!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: I think they professor seems nice, but THE WORK LOAD is brutal. I hate this class. It's just so daunting. There's LOTS of reading every week, a quiz, and discussions. It's not particularly hard, but the work load is nearing unreasonable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: When I reached out about my grades she spelled my name wrong multiple times, was sarcastic, and was so unhelpful. It would've made a difference if she would've kept the total grade for the class updated or had the points on display but that was not the case. The class was not hard just a lot of tedious work with the discussions and quizzes.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: weekly discussions and unit tests. no lockdown and questions come straight from textbook. She wrote a book and its material is on tests. Both books are required overall very easy and I would recommend online.

Professor Pressley's religion class was actually very good! I know many people won't take it, but if you're looking for an interesting class regarding world religions, I'd suggest hers. She was very cordial with students, and the online version I took was overall solid. Would definitely take it again!

She's caring and wants me to do well, but I've said to her that it's complicated. To sum it up, I think the class is somewhat a joke. The course seemed unorganized, and the lectures are long and tedious, her exams are challenging, and has some unnecessary assignments. For example, peer evaluations are due Monday but had to turn in a paper copy.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Terrible teacher. Doesn't know anything about the class and thinks that she knows everything. Also an ex scientologist. Its a class with a lot of group work but 80% of your grade is from tests which makes no sense at all.

please avoid, lectures are boring, occasionally there was a movie/video to watch. If class is called she puts work to do on d2l but she makes it during the 50 min class time, if you don't get to it during the 50 min class time you get a 0 for a grade, she should leave the assignments open all day not just during scheduled class time.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: If you don't show up you will get points deducted from your final grade, I didn't miss a single class but found the material difficult, I truly tried hard to understand it and I ended up with a "D". She said I was 9 points away from a "B" and she could not bump me that far. In reality I was 1pt away from a"C". She can't do basic division.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: This class is not an easy A. she does not have sympathy for anything, she counted 10pts off my project and when asked about it she said I did well and that the 10pts did not matter that much. Her lectures are boring and her time lines are constantly changing and hard to follow, very unorganized on D2L. boring class, bring a pillow and blanket.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: A normal class could include student discussion, group projects, or watching a video. I paid attention half of the time. It could honestly be interesting tho. We'll sometimes talk about shows. Random topics.

After taking her class, I can honestly say it was one of the easiest A's I have ever received. The my biggest gripe is Karen is extremely strict on attendance. Each class she has a sheet that you sign, and if you miss more than x amount of classes, you get 5% off for each absence. This would be okay, but class activities are pretty useless.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Group participation is key to passing this class.  No FinalMid-terms, only online chapter quizzes.  Easy workload, however it may seem confusing at times depending on how your group comprehends some of the projects. Just show up to class, participate in your group, and coast.

She is not always helpful or clear, she depends on the group leaders to do her job, but overall the course is super easy. Lots of bonus point opportunities, finished this class with 560 points out of 527. Take her hybrid course and you will make an A for sure.

I took her hybrid class which I very much recommend. It only meets once a week and  there are some classes that you only meet with your group. You have two very very easy projects. Get the book. It is the key to passing the quizzes. She's a really nice lady and she gives the MOST extra credit out of any teacher I've ever had.  Easy A. No final.

Very easy class and an easy  A don't get me wrong but this professor is very unorganized. She is always changing due dates and is never really clear about her expectations. If you have the option to take another professor, please do so. If not, just be prepared to try and keep up with her inconsistent schedule and do things on your own.

SUCH AN EASY CLASS if you do the busy work. Dont sweat the projects or presentations because she goes sooo easy on the grading. I was a group leader so I got extra points at the end of the semester. Your group leader could be chill and let you sign in the following class to get credit for coming if u skip. LOVED the nonverbal unit! mostly online hw
She was super sweet! The class is an easy A if you put in the effort! Absolutely recommend taking her for communications!!!

This class was the hardest class I have taken my freshman year. It was meant to be an elective. She is not good at communication and is a tough grader. Don't even think about being a leaderco-leader because it isn't worth the pain and effort. She relies on the leaders to do her job. Be prepared to teach everything to yourself.

Prof Pressley is not the best teacher for this course. She might be better in an upper level class where the students have a little more going for them rather than being straight out of high school. She had HUGE technology issues FALL 2014. But rather than give the students the benefit of the doubt, she always made excuses why things didnt work.

Professor Pressley is very poised, and she has a calm voice. In COMM 1109, be prepared to basically only do group projects, but that's the case for almost all COMM 1109 professors. Honestly, her class was so easy that I used it to check my email and social media accounts, and got an A. If you show up to class she gives so much extra credit.
Horrible Professor. Never responds to emails. Really boring. Not understanding at all
Must go to class. Semester long group project. Super easy class.

Ms. Pressley was a great profesor. She used the textbook and workbook a lot and attendance is very important. If you miss a class with an unexcused absence it deductes points of your average at the end of the semester. You don't need to be a leader or co-leader to get an A in the class, just do your work and pay attention. I enjoyed the class!

A lot of classes were online which I didn't mind at all because I don't like lectures and the class was usually pretty boring. Oh, and if you want to make an A in the class, you need to be a leader or co-leader.

Very organized.  No test just online quizzes and 2 projects which are pretty easy.  Everything is usually done in groups so make sure to find a good group during the first few days of class.  Also keep up with D2L cause she uses that a lot in this class.

Nice and great professor with interesting background. Online quizzes, no tests, 2 big (easy, but don't procrastinate) projects. Attendance is MANDATORY (1 letter grade drop for each missed class). Very easy class even if you have no interest in class. Find a GOOD group. Teaches mainly from powerpoints and videos.

Great professor. Great person. Two big projects that seem scary but are really no big deal. No tests, just simple online quizzes. Our class wasn't supposed to be hybrid but she kind of made it that way which worked out well.
She is a horrible teacher. Unclear and unorganized.

She is incredibly organized and even if you miss a class you know exactly what happened. Check the checklist daily to keep up. There is a project at the end but she helps a lot. This class is so easy! You have some workbook pages to do and quizzes that you use your book and the ppt. Would recommend her over anyone else! Made an A+!

Ms. Pressley is sweet and has a lot of experience. Her class is fairly easy, and is interesting. SHe uses D2L a lot, she posts notes and everything on there. At times their is a lot of work, but she offers a checklist online to help keep you organized. All in all i would recommend her! Willing to help as long as you are putting some effort in.

She has the best course schedule I've ever seen, so if you miss class, you know exactly what is being done everyday. We worked in groups for the entire semester (100 students in class) so that was cool (because I liked my group) No final, just two group projects which are pretty easy. All of the quizzes are open book and online. Easy A.
Very approachable teacher, replies back to emails every time. A lot of simple work, and you have groups you can go to. Easy A, you do use the book. Recommended!!!

This was the best professor I have ever had. She was extremely helpful always returning emails in a timely manner. She does require homework but it was very easy and she gives time to do it  in class. She was well organized and gives extra credit opportunities. Take her if you can!

Great teacher! Explains what you need to do on assignments clearly.  Class isn't that hard as long as you pick a good responsible group when groups are assigned. She likes when individuals are creative on their projects. HW is quick and easy. Tests are straight from the study guide. Overall I thought the course was pretty interesting.

Amazing professor! I loved working with her as one of the leaders. She replies quickly to your emails and is willing to help her students the best possible way. You can work on wkbks during class. You can have up to 2 absences before losing points. Tests and projects are easy, just take a little effort. Overall, easy class if you just do your work!

This class saved my semester! I didn't think I'd like being in a room with 90 students but her topics were interesting and students are grouped for discussions and projects. She loves to teach and it shows. Her tests are more from her powerpoints than the book. Take her--but know that she has a tough attendance policy.

This class was so easy! She doesn't go over the power points because she gets so distracted, but she puts them all online. If you do the study guide for that tests you should get an A. One drawback is that you're placed in a group. Make sure you take it with a friend! It's a pointless, boring, easy class. Definitely take her.
Not well organized.

This professor is okay not the best or worst. She is very unorganized and does give ALOT of homework. The test are not to bad if you do the study sheet which takes 4evr and isnt straight foward so its alot of work. Your in groups in this class the entire semester which can be a good or bad thing. over all unless I had too I would'nt take her again.
She is really nice, but does give out a lot of homework.  As long as you do it, you should be fine.  I made an A in the class, after doing a final portfolio which was optional.

Her class is a lot of homework, but that's to be expected. She is a nice lady but sometimes the assignments are unclear and everything is graded on 100% accuracy (even if you got the right answer but just used the wrong editing symbol). I got a B, so it's not impossible, but you will find yourself confused, bored, & overwhelmed often in her class.

If you want an A, do not take her. She is a sweet person but as a professor she is rarely prepared for class and is never clear on assignments. The class is already difficult as it is, she makes it ten times harder. She grades everything on accuracy. Slackers stay clear.
